channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report I-2024110075
item.description:
Report I-2024110075

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-28T06:19:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/18/2024 hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL Express LIC facility, located at 12-12 33rd Avenue, Long Island City, NY 11106. Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains , UN3481 Lithium ion batteries packed with equipment UN1266 Perfumery products UN1950 Aerosols, flammable Class 9 t Class 3 Class 2.1 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Case Packaging Type: Bottle Packaging Type: Receptacle Material of Construction: Plastic' Material of Construction: Glass Material of Construction: Metal Package Capacity: 247 g Package Capacity: 50 mL Package Capacity: 50 g Amount in Package: 247 g Amount in Package: 50 mL Amount in Package: 50 g Number in Shipment: 2 Number in Shipment: 2 Number in Shipment: 2 Number Failed: 2 Number Failed: 2- Number Failed; 2

item.title: Report E-2024110466
item.description:
Report E-2024110466

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: PLATTSBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0957 ET, XPO-XPL notified ERTS of a cargo release of approximately 1 gallon of spar clean 50 released from a plastic jug due to an accident (discovered container broken on the wall). The release impacted was contained to the pallet. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined contractors' assistance would be necessary due to Haz class 8 corrosive and pg II, the Caller SCM Tom Brooks said Dispatch wouldn't be necessary and he would handle the cleanup with proper PPE.
